Create the two files for the combined lists
Assemble the info on every macro

The AppleScript to get the raw data

Actions.ActionName: Formatting
Write to file
Merge the two files into one with one group per line
Remove the UUID files if they happen to be there (they shouldn't)
Actions.Text:
if [ -f "$KMVAR_rg_MBU_tNewestBackup"/"$KMVAR_instance_UUIDm" ]; then
rm "$KMVAR_rg_MBU_tNewestBackup"/"$KMVAR_instance_UUIDm"
fi

if [ -f "$KMVAR_rg_MBU_tNewestBackup"/"$KMVAR_instance_UUIDg" ]; then 
rm "$KMVAR_rg_MBU_tNewestBackup"/"$KMVAR_instance_UUIDg"
fi

Actions.ActionName: Remove / and : from names - to make Finder matching much simpler
Remove the interim files
The wicked fast and slick new way
Get and format all macro-related UUID stuff
Actions.Text:
if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launch

-- Script #1: Get macro group UUIDstell application "Keyboard Maestro"	set macroGroupList to get macro group of macros	set idList to {}	repeat with macroGroup in macroGroupList		set end of idList to id of macroGroup	end repeatend tell-- Script #2: Get macro UUIDstell application "Keyboard Maestro"	set macroCount to count macros	set UUIDList to {}	repeat with i from 1 to macroCount		set macroUUID to (get id of macro i)		set end of UUIDList to macroUUID	end repeatend tell-- Script #3: Get macro namestell application "Keyboard Maestro"	set macroCount to count macros	set NameList to {}	repeat with i from 1 to macroCount		set macroName to (get name of macro i)		set end of NameList to macroName	end repeatend tell-- Combine the listsset combinedList to {}set itemCount to (count of idList)repeat with i from 1 to itemCount	set combinedItem to item i of idList & "###" & item i of UUIDList & "###" & item i of NameList	set end of combinedList to combinedItemend repeat-- Convert the combined list to textset AppleScript's text item delimiters to linefeedset combinedText to combinedList as textset kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"	setvariable "instance_UUIDmacros" instance kmInst to (combinedList as text)end tell

Actions.ActionName: Save to file
Get and format all group-related UUID stuff
Actions.Text:
if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launch

tell application "Keyboard Maestro"	set groupUUID to get id of macro groups	set groupName to get name of macro groupsend tellset combinedList to {}repeat with i from 1 to count of groupUUID	set groupUUIDText to (item i of groupUUID) as text	set groupNameText to (item i of groupName) as text	set combinedRecord to groupUUIDText & "###" & groupNameText & linefeed	set end of combinedList to combinedRecordend repeatset kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"	setvariable "instance_UUIDgroups" instance kmInst to (combinedList as text)end tell
